titleStmt.title: Clinton B. Fisk to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2321

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Bureau Refugees, Freedmen and Abandoned Lands,
States of Kentucky, Tennessee and Nor. Alabama.

ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE,
Nashville Tenn Dec 30th 1865
Hon Thos E. Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky

I have the honor to request that you appoint David T. Terry Esq of New. York. a "Commissioner of Deeds &c for Kentucky -- Captain Terry has been a faithful soldier in the late war -- is a good lawyer and a christian gentleman. I will thank you for his Commission. which may be sent to myself or to him direct at No 200 Mulberry St New. York.

I am Sir with great Respect
Your Obt Servant
Clinton B. Fisk
Brevet Maj Genl
U. S. Vols

Comr of Deeds
New York
David T. Terry
apptd
&
Comd
5 Jany 1866
